website_summaries.verdict: An affordably priced, smartphone-sized device that emits both vibration and an audio alarm.
pros: Highly accurate and easy to hold

customer_reviews.title: Radek RD1503+
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the RD1503+ because there has been a rumor in my area that radioactive material was accidentally dumped many many years ago. I am retired and need something to do to keep from going nuts. I like to hike and while hiking thought I might look to see if the rumors were true. I'll let you know if I find anything. The unit is the best you can find at a low price. Your tech support is the best I have encountered of all the products I've bought on line. Keep up the good work, it's nice to know some company's care about what the customer need. Pete
customer_reviews.author: Peter J.

customer_reviews.title: Limited detection but a great little unit, smaller than a deck of playing cards.
customer_reviews.text: Unit has limited detection capability but sufficient for warning of a disaster. With all the nuclear unrest in the world I thought it prudent to invest in this monitor. I monitored my location for a few weeks to determine a "base line" to compare to. Now my unit sits, batteries out, patiently waiting for me to activate it if we are alerted to an increase in atmospheric nuclear crap from a dirty bomb or from a country fluffing it's feathers.

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for household use

In short..."There's nothing to fear more than fear itself"...perhaps not the exact quote...but ever more applicable today than when FDR spoke those words. If you're concerned about radiation levels, this is an efficient, affordable, well-made radiation detector.
customer_reviews.author: Top Wrench

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price and excellent conversation item for the coffee table.
customer_reviews.author: james willis

customer_reviews.title: Didn't find any rads here
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for those wanting to check their property for government dumped radiation from years past. Luckily I didn't find a smidgeon of radio activity. I did buy a radioactive rock from Utah to check the unit to make sure it did what it's supposed to do and it did sound off when we got near. Very good unit. This will be saved for the day when we all may really need this tool. It may save your life.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyD

customer_reviews.title: Great peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: We have had problems in the past with Radon in our home. I had a radon mitigation system (a negative pressure exhaust system) installed but I wanted to keep an eye on the radon values in my home. I purchased this detector to help monitor for real-time Radon levels in my home. Unfortunately, I have found it monitors ambient radiation and not specifically Radon gases. If you are looking for something to monitor Radon gases you may want to look at a product specifically for Radon in homes.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the user's manual has been updated because I found the manual to be complete and easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: Before purchase, I read a review complaining about inadequate user's manual. Maybe the user's manual has been updated because I found the manual to be complete and easy to follow. This devise is simple and easy to use. As far as I'm concerned, it's perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Forman

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine, for a while .....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit a couple of years ago and have barely used it. Today I started it up and found that the detector component had ceased to function, even with fresh batteries. The logic and data display portions of the unit itself seem to work OK, but it doesn't even pick up background radiation and settles at 0.00 after a couple of minutes. I'd give this one star, but it's been a couple of years since it was new, and worked fine, so I'll give it two.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Fmouse

customer_reviews.title: Its not working!
customer_reviews.text: It broke already! Used it once when it was first delivered in October. Carefully removed the batteries after the first use and today when I tried it out again no readout, no lights, no display. Changed the batteries out with fresh ones and still nothing...I'm disappointed.

product_meta.title: RADEX RD1503+ w/o dosimeter: High accuracy Geiger counter, radiation detector (English)
product_meta.description:
ATTENTION: As of August 1st, 2013, Quarta-Rad upgraded RADEX 1503 to RADEX 1503 Plus. Upgraded firmware, additional features, and cost the same as RADEX 1503. Don't be fooled by online vendors selling old and unsupported RADEX 1503 model as new. When you buy RADEX 1503 online, make sure it is RADEX 1503 Plus (Radex 1503+)

Now there is a better, stronger and more advanced version of our best-selling workhorse – the RD1503.

Ever since the introduction of the original RD1503, customers have been asking for additional functions and requested certain improvements on the existing design. We have listened and incorporated many new capabilities into RD1503+:


New and Improved Features of RADEX RD1503+

+ Graduated change of a threshold signal in the range from 0.10 to 0.90 µSv/h with an 0.10 µSv/h interval (available in individual settings).

+ Value of the background dose rate is saved even when the device is turned off.

+ Now displays the difference of the dose rate between the averaged and background values.

+ Includes vibration signal and audio alarm (both adjustable).

+ Added animation of the pressed command button (the icon of the button starts blinking on the display).

This new device allows a quick and easy way to check radiation background of top soil, non-edibles and interior premises.
The quality of indication of any dosimeter depends primarily on the built-in detector of ionizing radiation. RADEX RD1503+ contains a low-voltage SBM20-1 type Geiger-Muller counter of beta- and gamma-radiation which is found used in professional dosimetric equipment.
An expert scientific tool that’s made for an average Joe. 

Quick, Simple, and now better than ever!
